author: Jeremy Jensen
comment: The weather is based off current time zone, as opposed to actual location. So even though I'm in salt lake city, I'm getting the weather for Denver (which is in the same time zone).

reply.author: STETTINER
reply.content: Hey Jeremy. Sorry for a late reply and thank you for your valuable feedback. We have based the weather on your current location (which is automatically taken from Android's settings - when in auto mode (time zones) weather is showing the local values as you move between cities). Will try to improve it when updating this watch face.

title: Weather feature needs work

author: Gilbert Justiniano
comment: Crashes at first. When I get it to appear in my watch, 3d does not work & color does not change during night time. Original & flat design both not working.  I tried uninstalling & installing it 4 times. Still the same.Please fix it.

reply.author: STETTINER
reply.content: Hey Gilbert. Bad to hear about your issues :( Please try to uninstall the app on your phone, download it and synchronize again. PS Settings are also managed via phone app - please try it.

author: Paul D Hinds
comment: Awesome app for travelers who want to keep tabs with their time at home.  It would be awesome if we could change the weather source to AccuWeather or another weather app that could sync better. Wouldn't mind doing away with the seconds either.

reply.author: STETTINER
reply.content: Hey Paul. Probably, there is a connection issue between your watch and the phone. Please make sure that devices are connected and phone has got Internet access. Please restart Time Zones app on the phone and everything should work fine. Hope it will help. Will consider your idea (regarding seconds) when updating the app. Thanks for your feedback :)

title: Travelers Dream

author: Scott McPeak
comment: It started out great, our adult children are missionaries overseas so with this app I can tell what time it is there...But it only worked for two days and now it force closes all the time and can't use it at all now. Please help me to fix this problem...

reply.author: STETTINER
reply.content: Hey Scott. Bad to hear about your issue :( Please try to uninstall the app, restart your device and install it again. If it won't help, please deliver your purchase order's number (sayhello@stettiner.eu) and we will refund the purchase.

comment: This is a great watchface well worth the 99c for a traveller (and for style points). Instead of having a long list of cities, i woud suggest having a list of GMT timezones, and the option to manually name each GMT timezone. This way, everyone can have their own city listed, instead of just one from the list. In addition, it would let people name timezones as "home", which would be useful. Another suggestion is to add a toggle to turn off animations completely, including the movement of the sun in flat mode.

reply.author: STETTINER
reply.content: Hey Oren. Thanks for the positive feedback and 4 stars. Will try to improve it when updating the app :)

title: Great, but needs some tweaks

author: Howard Bamber
comment: Would be nice to have choice of colours, not just if one is am and one pm. The sun moon would still show that..seconds need to be off for battery. An extra star for the response.. Action on the seconds is needed. It eats the battery. Apart from that it's a great watch and a widget! I've paid for less. Especially like the widget. All watches should do this. Oh a star for that! BE NICE TO SEE OTHER WATCHES GIVE A WIDGET TOO. LOOKS GREAT AND BEING DUEL TIME IS SOMETHING I'D TROUBLE WITH FINDING A NICE ONE:))9*

reply.author: STETTINER
reply.content: Hey Howard. Thanks for the feedback :)! Will consider your ideas when updating the app.

title: Be nice if face was bi colour

author: David Calvillo
comment: This app is pretty cool specially when you are traveling, it's getting better, but still needs some work. Phone and watch battery percentage would be a nice addition, also, when you traveling different time zones, the app could shift time zones automatically in order to have the correct time zone on top, also would be a nice addition to be able to change the time zone from the watch when you are on airplane mode. And the weather provider should be an option like Weather channel or Accuweather

reply.author: STETTINER
reply.content:
Hey David,
Thanks for your feedback :) If you have chosen "default time zone" in settings, then the watch will always display time of your current location :) Will try to add batteries levels, when updating TimeZones.

title: Nice app for travelers

comment: It never synced with my moto 360 sport. Didn't even show up in android wear app.. Waste of money absolutely

author: Carlos Flores
comment: Edited review:  It works great on all my wear devices (Moto 360, LG G Watch, Asus Zenwatch). After help from the dev, it now works flawlessly.  Love the widget too!

reply.author: STETTINER
reply.content: Hey Carlos. Bad to hear about your issues. We have just tested - works fine on our moto 360. Please make sure that battery levels of the phone and watch are 60%+ and force manual synchronization in Android Wear app on your phone. Hope it will help.

title: Great app!

author: Jonas Olan
comment: I alwatys receive a crash report on my phone. I love the app but the crash sucks! Fix it please, samsung note 5

author: Adrian Camarena
comment: Would be nice to have the option to change the color, maybe black background with white text etc. Also, custom name the time zones? So one could select a time zone, but name it something else, for instance a city. For example, select US Pacific, with the option to name it "Fairfield, Ca" as oppsed to having a huge list of cities for each time zone. Last individual weather for each zone would be cool. But still the app does a lot as it is and am very happy with it.

reply.author: STETTINER
reply.content: Hey Adrian. Thanks for the positive feedback and 4 stars rating :)! Will consider your ideas when updating the app.

title: Almost Perfect, Still Love It

author: Malinda
comment: Rather than having such a limited number of cities (really? Shanghai, but not Beijing?), it would be much better if we could just set the GMT +/-, then name the city or location manually ourselves.

reply.author: STETTINER
reply.content: Thank you for your valuable feedback. Will consider your idea if you give us more than 1 star ;)

author: Tom Hansen
comment: Fantastic! Just what I was looking for. I emailed the developer asking for a larger clock for the primary time on top and received an email right back with positive results of a possible option in the future. That is the sign of a good developer!

author: Gene Rubenstein
comment: There doesn't seem to be an Indian standard time zone (I.e New Delhi)?  I would think all timezones would be foundational for something like this

reply.author: STETTINER
reply.content: Hey Gene. Thanks for feedback. We know that the list isn't perfect yet. Will try to upgrade it, when updating this Watch Face.

title: Missing timezones?

author: jk yang
comment: Great watch face. Wish we could have a always black or at lease be able to use custom wallpaper. Not just half white and balck

reply.author: STETTINER
reply.content: Hey. Thanks for your feedback. Will consider this idea, when preparing another update :)

title: Could use more customization

author: Marvin Gaisey
comment: Just the watch face I was looking for, though I noticed the sun/moon black and white backgrounds do not match up with the sunrise and sunset times in the actual locations. The sun set hours ago but the app still shows a sun even at nine pm.

reply.author: STETTINER
reply.content: Hey Marvin. Thanks for the positive feedback and 4 stars. Right now, sun / moon appears on fixed hours - night last from 22:00 till 6:00. Will try to improve it when updating the app :)

author: Gugulethu Gregory
comment: Night time screen darken doesn't work anymore
Bought the app but unable to sync with LG G WATCH URBANE just wondering is it compatible or not please advice regards

author: Vivek T
comment: I am not getting to load weather on SmartWatch 3. It just says, "loading weather". On the phone app, I am able to see weather though.

author: Saravana Kumar
comment: Suggestions: Please make the timezone showing up on the watch to be user customizable.

reply.author: STETTINER
reply.content: Hey Saravana. Thanks for the positive feedback and 5 stars rating :)! Will consider your idea (more time zones / cities) when updating the app.

title: Good one and exactly what I was looking for!

author: Chris O'Kane
comment: Love it pretty and functional :-) Would it be possible to add watch / phone battery stats?

reply.author: STETTINER
reply.content: Hey Chris. Thanks for the positive feedback and stars :) Will consider your idea when updating this watch face.

title: Please can you add battery

author: Edmund Jolly
comment: Could add more cities? - would like to choose more cities instead of just "Berlin"

reply.author: STETTINER
reply.content: Hey Edmund. Thanks for the positive feedback and 4 stars. Will try to improve it when updating the app :)

title: Looks great!

author: Ben Mounsey
comment: Great watch face, but please, let me turn the seconds ticker off!

reply.author: STETTINER
reply.content:
Hey Ben, "Flat" sun and moon (as an option) are available in the updated app (v 3.0). Please download and check it. 
Thanks for your input in Time Zones' development :)

title: Great utility!

author: Chih-En Wu
comment: Can you add feature to hide seconds? Thanks.

author: Houtan N
comment: Need more than two cities

reply.author: STETTINER
reply.content: Hey Houtan. Thanks for a positive rating :) It will be rather hard to present more than 2 times on 1 face, but we will keep your idea in mind, when updating the app.

author: Marc Ole Bulling
comment: Great watchface! It would be nice to have a search option for the timezones

author: Bartosz Wietrzyk
comment: Great for working with people abroad.

reply.author: STETTINER
reply.content: Hey Bartek. Thanks for the positive feedback and 5 stars rating :)!

title: Very useful

author: Roy Alexander
comment: Really nice and simple. Love it!

reply.author: STETTINER
reply.content: Hey Roy. Thanks for the positive feedback and 5 star rating :)!

title: Smart!

author: Rich Stuppy
comment: Simple and effective
title: Very nice for travel

author: Chris Engler
comment: Helps me manage a team in a different time zone. Would like to modify name of selected time zone and display the current date of my default time zone.

reply.author: STETTINER
reply.content:
Hey Chris,
Dates for both time zones added - as requested. Please update the app. 
Thanks for your help / ideas :)

title: Good, but not great... yet.

author: Ivy A Nguyen
comment: I love having this as I use UTC on my phone & want local time on my watches. Would be nice if we can eventually see weather next to the clocks, too.

reply.author: STETTINER
reply.content:
Hey Ivy,
Weather (for the current location) has been implemented in Today's update. Please check it. Thank you for your help / idea :)

title: Just what I was waiting for!

author: Zap Mapua
comment: Nice! Please update it with options for different colors. I would to have a black theme to save on battery. Great App!
title: Great for frequent travelers

author: Tony B
comment: If you could remove the seconds counter (option) and make the time text larger I would happily buy and promote this.

reply.author: STETTINER
reply.content: Hey Tony. Thanks for the positive feedback and 3 stars. Will try to improve it when updating the app :)

title: One big fault

author: Paul Franek
comment: Definitely does what it says it does.  I was quite interested in using the homescreen widget, but it isn't resizable, which is a deal-breaker for my homescreen setup.

reply.author: STETTINER
reply.content: Hey Paul. Thanks for the positive feedback and 4 stars. Will try to improve it when updating the app :)

title: Works as advertised
